DataElement.preferredName: Death Certificate COVID-19 Contributing Factor Registration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication whether or not COIVD-19 was listed or recorded officially as a contributing factor to a person's death on the death certificate.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Death Diagnosis Domain Death Certificate SARS Coronavirus 2 Contribution Factor Registration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis._A certified document issued by either a medical practitioner or a governmental agency that details the date, location and cause of a death of an individual._A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak._The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result._Anything that contributes causally to a result._The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to death diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A certified document issued by either a medical practitioner or a governmental agency that details the date, location and cause of a death of an individual.
A positive-sense single-stranded RNA virus in the genus Betacoronavirus. It is the causative agent of the 2019-2020 severe acute respiratory syndrome outbreak.
The part played by somebody or something in bringing about an end or result.
Anything that contributes causally to a result.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
